column4: Hi i upgrraded to ubuntu 9.10 ..  i had resolution problems .. and it got solved now ( though i didnt do anything) .. bt now , the computer is VERY slow.... how do i get the usual speed ??????
The sppeed is toooooo low
have dpkg check for broken packages was a good start for me
hwo do i do that ?
how to do that ? plz help me. i am a n0b
i did it by going into the repair console through grub and choosing dpkg
ok.. during booting time ?
i am rebooting now.
Hi
any luck?
i got into recovery mode.. but it didnt respond.. if i press  arrow keys . it places texts everywhere on the screen.. and the computer is still VERY VERY slow and irrresponsive
odd. dont know if i can help then. maybe one of the gurus here can tell you how to check for broken packages from the terminal
probably wouldnt hurt to run an fsck either
ok.
what to run in my terminal now ?
i am not very fluent in terminal myself... just type fsck and see what happens :)
oh yeah... that's why you do it from boot
if i cant do that from boot, how to do now ?
lemme test something...
did you get that memo?
ok.. hurd is helping me now.. i am folllowing his steps.. thanksyou
good luck :)
thanks! B-)
